intro: Zosterophyllanthos phyllocardioides, commonly known as the heart-shaped zosterophyllum, is a rare and specialized plant with unique botanical features. It belongs to the order Zosterophyllophyta, which includes ancient, prehistoric plants. The plant exhibits a distinctive morphology with heart-shaped leaves and a simple, branching structure. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its conservation status is vulnerable due to habitat loss and limited distribution.
